place_description: Contemporary spot serving high-end coffee drinks, plus tea & light fare like toasts & yogurt.

reviews_data.review_text:
Sorry but is the worst coffee I had drinking in my life.
I come at 8:10pm and ask for vanilla latte and he informed me it's will take like 20 minutes, so i decided to go with normal coffee and it's very very very (not a coffee) they have a unique slogan ( not just a coffee) but I didn't think they are serious about this!
Also it cost me like 4.6$

I'm feeling so bad they ruined my morning

Btw, don't open your door if you can't serve your full menu at the time... we have jobs on time
The coffee is worse than the Dunkin donuts and the selection of breakfast items are slim!

Wow not only does this place have the best iced latte in Charlotte but the food is also incredible. The scones are delish. Best quiche I've ever had - today it was bacon cheddar and tomato. Soooooo good. Please open a location in Huntersville!!!

Stopped by this cafe before check-in during our Charlotte trip. The modern interior with wooden elements and spacious layout gave off a cozy vibe right off the bat.

We ordered a matcha latte, chai latte, and an almond croissant. The lattes were pretty milk-heavy, so the matcha and chai flavors didn't really come through. The almond croissant was generous enough to tide us over, though.

It was a quick visit, but I could see this place being great for chilling out or getting some work done. Solid spot overall!
So good
Great coffee and great food.

This is kinda another white-wall hipster coffeeshop that's indistinguishable from others out of the same cookie cutter. Good rose lattes in the spring, that's cool. Not really any power outlets, that's not cool.
Muy buen sitio para disfrutar de un compartir agradable
Absolutely wonderful coffee shop. Great jazz music. Excellent coffee. Loved the atmosphere. Best oatmeal cookie I've had in a very long time. Iced and hot lattes were superb.
Cute little place to do some work, meet up with friends or just hang out. Plenty of seating options both inside and out. Will definitely stop by again.
Tasty breakfast and kind mannered employees
Great local coffee chain. The coffee is great and the shop has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.

I love this place. One of the baristas made a perfect latte for me just based off telling him how I like it. I just have one question for management: do you always allow your employees to come to work with no bra and see-thru clothing? It seems wildly inappropriate for a coffee shop setting.
Good coffee but they have really (really) slow service and need some process optimization classes
I love this coffee shop the avocado toast is to die for the service is amazing. The manager Mary Jo is the best.
I got a spiced chai which was amazing and also a vanilla taro latte which was also great! Amazing atmosphere to do school work or connect with friends!

Great little spot with more to offer than coffee.

One of the best poached eggs I've ever had.
Great coffee, super service, and last but not least, they can prepare any sandwich gluten free!!
The friendliest staff who work quick! My favorite place to get lattes and the best quiche! I am pleased every time I come here, and highly recommend!

Fabulous coffee shop where I had a delicious Americano and the most incredible avocado toast on yummy bread with pickled onions and sun-dried tomatoes - absolutely delicious! I would definitely go back and highly recommend!

Amazing cappuccino! The BEST ginger chai! The atmosphere is perfect for remote work, bright, open, and fun music! This will definitely be a regular spot for me to drop into when dropping friends off at CLT!
Cute place!!
What a cute and quaint space. Make sure you look at the menu and get specific. The staff can be new. Ask the Caramel Macciatto to be made like a latte to have the American experience vs. traditional

Nice, spacious cafe for hanging out and/or working. Lots of tables outside when the weather is nice. I like that they also serve food if you're looking for a light breakfast or snack.

Staff was friendly and knowledgeable about their various coffee drinks, but it would be helpful too if the menu provided the drink sizes.

Really enjoyed our time visiting. The cold brew with vanilla and caramel. The tea was really unique. It was a relaxed vibe and the drinks came out at a good pace. The staff was friendly and helpful. A good place to do some work or catch up with people.
Great place for a casual meeting or to get some work done! The coffee is great too.

Classic "I'll give 3 stars because 2.5 isn't an option" review, but I've been here a couple times, and I can genuinely say this place is "mid" at best. First time coming here to actually get some work done (I don't work from home, but I had some tax and general stuff to do) I can't imagine actually doing job related work here, the vibe isn't relaxing at all, and the seating is atrociously uncomfortable. Normally I go to a cigar lounge, but I've been trying to cut back on my smoking, however if this is the average alternative, I may need to go back.

I love this place for coffee. One of the best in town. However, last night we went there for a special event. It is a terrible event space. The acoustics make it nearly impossible to hear anything. On top of that the PA system did not help. Every surface is hard reflective and it's like being in an echo chamber.

We only had Rose and a blonde brownie. Both were terrible

The experience was so bad we left at halftime even though the performer was wonderful.

I have been going to this coffee shop for a few months now and usually have a good experience unless I'm dealing with the blonde cashier guy with long hair named Cameron. I'm not sure what the issue is but every time I go in there he the rudest and most unfriendly person I've come across. Never says a word and acts like I'm giving him the biggest inconvenience when all I do is try to order. I usually try to brush it off but I couldn't the other day after I was treated so rudely for being behind on picking up my to go order.  When I asked what was wrong he just scoffed and rolled his eyes at me. It is truly hurtful and such an unpleasant experience. Im not sure if it is bc of my skin color bc when I asked another person and see him interacting with others, it is never the same energy I get. It is really unfortunate bc I do like this shop and most of the other workers are amazing especially Kat! I've tried to reach out to the owners/manager to address this issue but no one has contacted me back.

They need to advertise they don't take cash. I drove to 3 other shops that were either closed or not there. I drove around for 30min to find this shop open only to find they don't take cash. Apparently they only cater to people who have credit cards or debit cards. Cash money, American currency not accepted here.

Great coffee in an open lively collaborative space. This place is great for co-working with others, or if you thrive while working in a more active environment. They have great coffee and fresh food. Overall a great place to get some work done or meet friends etc.
This coffee shop was the best and gave a pleasant outdoor environment. I  enjoyed my latte.
Great coffee & pastries with a lovely atmosphere!

The vibe was very nice. Very chill, nice old school 90's music, and good coffee. I had the avocado toast. Wasn't bad but am used to have a little more avocado on toast. Service was quick and made some great recommendations. If needing to concentrate on school work, office or want to read a book while enjoying coffee in a chill atmosphere...This is the spot. They have tables to accommodate for your laptop and wifi

Love this location! I've been to 7th street location but I really love this one. They have great working space and the staff is great as well as the coffee. Katie was the barista and she was great. She answered my many questions and had great recommendations. Will definitely be back soon. Thank you
Stopping in from NYC and all I can say is if you love a good espresso, this place is IT. Friendly and welcoming Baristas, really well crafted coffee, and a great view of Charlotte.
The coffee and cookie were delicious! The atmosphere and location was perfect for the meeting I had. We sat outside and really enjoyed it!

Spacious coffee shop in an industrial area turn business park.
Plenty of space and outdoor seating with a great view of the skyline.

This coffee shop was high quality and offered a nice open air environment. The employees were friendly and my order was made promptly even though they were busy. However, the prices do not reflect the portion sizes. A bacon egg and cheese was $10. Total order of two small coffees + two small biscuits was $32. Average tastes, nothing special. If you've got money to spend, go for it. If not, 7-11 is around the corner.

Stopped here for a late morning coffee & breakfast and loved it! "Not just coffee" is exactly right because their ricotta/jam biscuit and seasonal quiche were absolutely delicious. Great outdoor patio seating to enjoy your morning coffee on.
They don't accept cash.

Was looking forward to going here and having a place nearby that serves good espresso and espresso drinks. So disappointed in the customer service of lack thereof. I'm over going to places where people act like they don't want to be there, or they could care less about you. You're in customer service, if you can't learn how to be friendly and hospitable then choose something else for work. When a customer says "have a nice day" and you say nothing back you're in the wrong line of work. The coffee was good, but that's not hard to do.

The guy with the blonde bob, let my coffee sit for twenty minutes & get cold because he never said it was ready. Then when I asked for him to warm it up he said he couldn't. All of them just have a IDGAF attitude. Cute for working but you can pass on the coffee & food. A cold $8 latte is sad. And it tasted like he put pepper in it. I don't recommend, there are definitely better locations
Food and service were good. Visiting from out of town. Would come back again.
I went there twice this past week. Both times my coffee tasted very burnt. The barista was very sweet & the work space is incredible! Loved how spacious it was.
Awesome coffee brunch Date with my girl. Cute little spot
Dropped by from out of town to do some work but there wasn't any working Wi-Fi.

Love NJC in Charlotte, this location is probably my favorite. Because it's connected to Hygge (a co-working space) it is designed as a great place to meet with people or have productive work. Coffee is good too (which is definitely important)
The coffee is always spot on here! Well done!

Super cool place. Fast and friendly service. Will definitely be back!
Gracias
Great spot for cold brew and a light breakfast. My wife and I got the Avocado Toast & breakfast sandwich. Both were very tasty. The breakfast sandwich was on smaller side, but still super tasty.
They close early without changing the hours on social media or their website.
Large space including outdoor area with a good atmosphere. My latte was good but not worth $8... hard to support when it costs more than Starbucks. Also didn't have any sugar-free options.

This is my regular coffee place, and they consistently serve tasty coffee and light breakfast meals.  If you're in the area I'd highly recommend a visit.

I'd say their avocado toast is the best in town - definitely try it with the sundried tomatoes and onion.  The granola parfait is great as well.

The baristas are friendly and actually know how to make coffee and espresso beverages.  Service is generally quick.  The atmosphere is really nice, especially on a day with good weather - they will open the big garage doors to open our onto the patio.

They have free wifi and plenty of seating so this is a great place to work for an afternoon or collaborate with colleagues.

It's also a great placefor hosting a small event.  Because this is mine and my husband's regular coffee place, we decided to host an informal brunch the day after our wedding here.  They were super accommodating and made sure we have everything we needed.  It was very reasonably priced for renting a part of their space.  We brought in outside catering and served NJC coffee.

Plenty of seating options both indoors and outdoors with outlets. However the wifi isn't free.  Drinks are general priced $4-$5. Kitchen closes at 2 pm but they will let you bring outside food if the Kitchen is closed.  Staff is really nice.
Best Quiche I've had.  Excellent.
Presso bar notjustcoffe personale eccellente ed educato servizio veloce
Great coffee, excellent seating options, and fantastic food options; especially the scones and avocado toast. The staff is extremely polite, a coffee shop you could really spend the whole day in.
Coffee choices are somewhat limited but I really enjoy the atmosphere. Great spot for catching up with people.

Disappointed. I was excited when this came up on my suggestions, looked really nice. The food was okay, but felt really really unwelcome. When ordering I was never asked if it was for take out, I ordered two meals. When my name was called our food was packed to go as if we were leaving. (My biggest clue we weren't welcome.) tried to dig the waffles out of the to go box and then re-plate them myself. It was not good. Will not return, do not recommend. It's just gentrification, and if you live in the neighborhood like we do, you're not welcome either.
Girls on Sunday were so cool and helpful. I'm coming back to this location just because of their service.
Delicious, legit cappuccino with friendly service and tasty treats.

Came here to support PFO!!! I love the environment and the show! The banana nut bread was ... idk how to describe it... but it wasn't something I'd ever eat again.  if I had ate breakfast I would have been ok. Overall the space is nice and I did enjoy my kombucha!!! I'd return to enjoy the space only.  I would NOT recommend trying the banana nut bread.
Nice place. Good stuff though a bit overpriced.  Neat atmosphere, good for a business coffee. Street parking was good.
Good coffee and sandwiches!
Best coffee I've had in a while.

My mom said the coffee was a little strong, but man was the biscuit I got so good. It was a little bit under-baked when I first got it, but they graciously remade it for me and it was perfect after that. I really enjoy coming here. Gosh, now I'm thinking about that biscuit again.
The iced coffee is amazing and I had the avocado and toast with poached eggs to go with it. The food was stellar.
Best coffe in North Carolina
Incredibly kind staff, coffee to give you the zoomies, an incredible work space, plus a patio with a view. Can't lose! I will be a new regular :)

Met for lunch here today. I had the Lox Toast. It was very tasty. It's a combination of wheat toast / cream cheese smear / smoked salmon* / capers dill lemon. It was very good...prepared just right!

The service was quick and the ambiance is chic and trendy. It's a spacious place, somewhat loud.

On a recent visit the coffee was great as always but wish I could say the same about the food. Came in hoping for their newly advertised breakfast sandwich but apparently it's only offered during the week. Would have been nice if that was stated somewhere on their web site or IG. So we opted for the breakfast biscuit sandwich and toast with a poached egg. The sandwich was terrible. No better than a egg McMuffin sandwich with a pre-prepared egg puck like you get at McDonald's. The poached egg on the toast was over cooked.  Service was also kind of meh. I'll just stick to the coffee from now on.

It's a nice coffee shop with super friendly staff. There's a nice variety of drinks and the inclusion of a bar and actual food is great.
They can open the windows to make for an even more open sitting/lounging area. The open space keeps you from feeling bunched up against others and this is nice. There is a ton of seating both inside and out.

There aren't any "nooks" or corners where you can have a bit of privacy. This may not matter to some but I like it in a coffee shop; it's a bonus of sorts.
There is also a bar that allows dogs across the street so you can sit outside and watch dogs at times and I love this.
Nice, spacious, great coffee with a rich flavor. Affordable, open to travelers
This place is wonderful. The owners are so kind and knowledgeable. They are now offering reiki and yoga. I can't wait to return! I highly recommend it.

Great location and excellent coffee. This location  has a large sitting/lounging/working/meeting area inside and plenty of patio seating. So come, bring your family or friends and sit and sip a spell.
Great space to get some work done, and great tasting coffee!
Great vibe. Incredible coffee.

Normally the coffee is great but today it was subpar. I asked for regular milk in my latte and was told they only have oat and almond. I went with almond and honestly I didn't enjoy my coffee today. I was reading the menu and noticed they upcharge for that particular milk but I didn't want it to begin with so I checked my receipt and to my surprise I was up charged for both of my drinks. It's not very much money but it seems a bit ridiculous to upcharge someone for something they didn't want when you didn't have the initial thing they ordered.
Great place to chill and grab tea, coffee or hot chocolate. I realized too late that they also serve a variety of other drinks such as Kombucha and Prosecco. Great service! Great staff!

I want to give njc five stars. I really, really do. the baristas are friendly, knowledgeable, and welcoming. the atmosphere at every location is very curated and well-designed. I just have too many friends who've worked for this company and I can't bring myself to give five stars. the employees are underpaid and underappreciated, and I find new faces every few months because their business just can't seem to retain folks for longer than that. as a customer, njc is great. but the place is called "not just coffee" because it's supposed to be about caring for people, not just coffee. it's supposed to be not just a business. and if they can afford to rent/buy these huge spaces and make them as beautiful as they do, they can afford to pay their employees as much as or more than Walmart or McDonald's.
Love this location! Great coffee and awesome atmosphere. It is a great place work or study from.

This is a very trendy spot with delicious drinks and food. The PB apple toast was amazing, but may be seasonal? There is a lot of space which is nice, but a lot of the tables weren't near outlets which made it more difficult to work from this coffee shop. The prices were also a little higher than other shops in the area.
This is a awesome store to just read and relax in drinking your morning cup of coffee or tea. The people who work in there is very nice and make you feel like you are home.
Ginger chai and avocado toast were so good! I highly recommand this place!
U had a cup of Chai Tea.
LOVE! Great place for studying and to chill with friends. The music was a little too loud but it has a nice ambiance.
Iced Chai with Oatmilk was fire  & the staff is kind.

I have always been a fan of NJC coffee but this was my first time to try their food. I got the lox toast and man that was exceptional! The toast was perfect and the lox was not overpowering. It was creamy and super delicious to the point that it got me to write a review !
Card only. That's a joke. Sure the food/coffee is probably great... and service is probably good too. You don't accept cash? Unreal and un business like.
This is a cool set up,very diverse. Loved the atmosphere, for once I wasnt sweaty and nervous
It is a very nice place, the people who serve are very kind and dedicated, they prepare a good espresso just like in Italy.

In a word: overpriced.
In more words:
I went here as I was in the area looking for dog boarding. I thought I'd check this place out. It's called Not Just Coffee but after 2pm it is Just Coffee, and of course the other expected coffee shop fare like tea and muffins. So if you want anything that isn't "just coffee" and it's the afternoon then your hopes are dashed.
But I didn't care too much and just ordered a latte. It was over 6 dollars after tax if I'm not mistaken. But the price wasn't that important to me as I assumed it would be a large (which I said in my order "a large latte")
Well it was super tiny. The cup went in my hand and reminded me of that shot of Andre the giant holding a beer can. Except he was a giant and I'm 5 feet 8 inches tall.
I asked "is this a large?" And he responded in a rather annoyed tone "it is all one size" which wasn't explained when i ordered a large size. Also for the price it is incredibly miniscule.
On top of this I was "dining inside" and I was given a disposable cup. Why are they giving tiny paper cups rather than mugs. I looked around and every person had a paper cup inside.
The latte was nothing special either. I hate Starbucks and I'd 100% rather go there than to this place ever again.
Awesome shop great food and great staff. This is the place I alway like to start my day .
Really good service. Thank you guys!
Good food. Great coffee. I recommend trying the R&J biscuit on the weekends.

This is the perfect place to work for a few hours. There's plenty of table space, couches, or patio seating to fit your mood. The atmosphere is airy and bright so its a great spot to feel inspired. The coffee is excellent and I get the quiche on a regular basis.
For a place full of caffeine they move kind of slow
Great atmosphere amazing coffee! Definitely will return on our next trip to charlotte!
We had a great time there!
Excellent coffee, bites, service, vibes, and atmosphere!
Great overall place. If you're looking for a breakfast biscuit sandwich (weekends), cold brew, a great space (especially long study sessions or with a group), among many other +'s -- this is it.
Great coffee and pastry but so hipster it hurt. Small portions and expensive
Favorite coffee shop to work in Charlotte. Very nice space and nice staff.

Very enjoyable coffee shop. The drinks and crafted with precision and the food is tasty. Unfortunately, the last two visits they ran out of the biscuits early on in the day. A little bit of a let down.

Good coffee. Open space. BUT....ROTTEN SERVICE. Also, no food after 2. AND no ceramic "for here" orders after 2. Even by request. Really, truly some of the worst customer service. I will take my business elsewhere moving forward.
Came in today for the first time. Daniel was super nice and very helpful. I will definitely be back

Decent coffee shop, the iced coffees were good but we could barely taste the expresso (weak). The outdoor vibe is great but the inside it too warehouse-like and isn't comfy like a normal coffee shop. Friendly staff.

Love the open space with Bar and working space! The staff members were kind and helpful. I got the  quiche, dirty chai and yogurt with granola. The yogurt is traditional Greek yogurt and thick! It was so delicious with the apples and candied pecans! I added the honey syrup they had too. They plated the items well too!!  Definitely stop by if you need to work for a couple of hours! It's not loud either and there is enough space to be COVID safe!!
Nice atmosphere, really good latte
Absolutely amazing coffee. Would go again.
Spacious, comfy, and cozy! Becoming one of my favorite spots! I do wish they were open later! But definitely enjoy going .
Nice atmosphere. Very pleasant experience.

Love the atmosphere but didn't love the false advertisement. In the coffee shop it states, lunch all day everyday. I tried to get lunch at 230pm and they told me that the kitchen closes at 2pm! The coffee was just okay, I had the vanilla iced latte. Definitely better coffee elsewhere

Definitely a nice vibe for coffee and more! Ordered a couple of things including their seasonal beverages. Plus the jam and ricotta biscuit which is amazing! Only things that were off (minute) was: communication (ordered for here, but given to go containers, also needed to get a drink that was ordered but hadn't been prepared ), and the biscuit came with no utensils. All in all go check them out!
Great place to work remotely. They have gluten free bread!
Nice place...
Great place for coworking
Calm, cute and comfortable. Brunch with my bestie. Avocado toast, a homemade pasty, and wine-Why not!?

Location is lovely with a nice view of the uptown skyline.  My biggest complaint is that they charge for refills on the batch brew so I won't be a return patron which is unfortunate as it is walking distance from my home.  Food selection was limited.  Had the yogurt parfait which was delicious.
I ate the quiche. Delicious but maybe a tiny bit over priced for the portion. Fun atmosphere and great location. No free refills on coffee so 4 stars.
Elejor cafe de Charlotte
Lovely coffee shop with great drink & staff. Perfect for remote work & also attached to a co-working space.
Good coffee and unique biscuit breakfast sandwich. Definitely check this place out if you want to get some work done and have a nice bite.
The avocado toast was great, loved the pickled onion addition. The oat milk cappuccino however could have been better/creamier if they used a better brand of oat milk.
Always a lovely experience visiting here! Delicious coffee and friendly staff!

Barista was very friendly, and very knowledgeable. Got a Japanese ice coffee, and it was great!

Location had lots of open space. Parking is shared with other stores so I had to park behind the building and walk around. Not a big deal, but it may be an obstacle for some.

Prices fir drinks were standard.
Beautiful and open indoor and outdoor space. They host pop up markets so it's a great place to get coffee and then support local businesses.
Super cozy coffee shop. Delicious coffee, kind workers, and fun atmosphere. Will be back!

Great place.
Good drink selections.
Enjoyed our time there.

10/10 What a great experience
I came in knowing nothing about coffee.. honestly, I didn't even like it.
A nice gentlemen named Alex listened to my ridiculous claims and was excited to change my mind AND HE DID.
Nice big space. They were super accommodating for a large party. Food is pretty good and the beers on tap were great!
If you want a shop where a dozen employees act like they're too cool to pay attention to anyone this is your spot. Not just coffee, apathy too!
That flat white coffee was the highlight of my day

Up from SC for a cup... Great flavor, perfectly poured, and a very friendly staff. It was a special Pop Up market Saturday with a DJ, great food vendors, and specialty shops being represented. Hands down, best "going for coffee" experience...
Love it......

I've been in Charlotte less than a year but currently this spot takes the cake in terms of coffee shops. Love the ambience, love the folks that work there, love the amount of seating!

It can be challenging to find a place to plug in your laptop but I like this place so much I just make sure my laptop is fully charged before I get there.
Limited but varied menu. I had quiche with arugula salad. Neat portions. Fast courteous service. Clean airy atmosphere. Great cup of coffee served in nice large ceramic cup and saucer.

Best coffee spot (any of the not just coffees) in town! This specific location has a lot of space and always is a great place to hangout or get some studying/work done. I'm picky on my coffee and the staff is very knowledgeable and always has great selections available. Cannot recommend them enough!
Great coffee and great ambiance. I was in Charlotte few days ago and had a chance to visit this coffee shop and will probably re visit when I am back in town.

It's one thing to have great coffee. It's another to have a phenomenal remote working and meeting space. But it's entirely a new concept when the owners and staff genuinely care about the community and their patrons. With the amount of locations they now have, I wouldn't see why anyone would want to go anywhere else. It truly is much much more than just coffee.
Wonderful coffee shop. Delicious drinks with a modern interior and large patio.
Really cool atmosphere and vibe. My friends and I go here even if we don't get coffee.

One of my favorite places in Charlotte; I visit it whenever I'm in the area. They have an amazing atmosphere and the aesthetic is very pleasant. They have an excellent selection of drinks and their food is delicious. It is definitely more of a place to come get a bite to eat with a friend or respond to emails then it is to just get a coffee to go.
Great atmosphere, great coffee!
Great atmosphere, great coffee, definitely get the lox toast
Great ambiance, music, coffee and service. I ll definitely go back
Great place, saturated latte, tasty sandwich. GREAT SATURDAY START;)
This place is crazy delicious.  Coffee was next level as was the avocado toast.

If you love coffee that can resurrect the dead and is delicious too, this is your place! Great large open shop with plenty of space to work, or relax over what I believe is the best coffee in the city. Location is also going to be so cool when all the development around it is complete. The location in uptown is smaller but just as nice.
Helpful and friendly staff, great coffee

I don't normally write reviews but I was recommended Not Just Coffee from a friend while I was visiting Charlotte. Upon visiting I was so delighted to be greeted by friendly staff and a gorgeous and spacious interior. I had the batch coffee and a matcha, both were served beautifully and tasted great. I ordered the quiche and was genuinely blown away. GET THE QUICHE.

Also, they take COVID regulations seriously!
Best latte in Charlotte. High ceilings and wide space. Wonderful Place.
Really nice atmosphere!
Beautiful setup, friendly staff and a great additiin to the expanding west side of Charlotte.
Awesome flavorful bhakti chai latte

Great spot for catching up with friends, small groups, or working. I loved how open the space was and modern design. The menu was fabulous. The chocolate cherry scone is a must try. The avocado toast was great, but they forgot the pickled onions. Overall good experience.
Love the people Not Just the Coffee; even though it's pretty amazing!

Reminiscent of ATL Beltline charm! What's not to love about the use of natural light to illuminate the space!? I was greeted by Mikayla at the counter and received stellar customer service. I ordered a Grapefruit Espresso Mule and it blew me away, definitely a new favorite.
Lots of space to relax enjoy a cup and work or chat!

Excellent coffee. Great space with lots of room. Good for coworking. Was passing through town and was on the hunt for craft coffee off the highway. This was only 5min from 85. Will definitely come again.
Always wonderful
Great cafe, not so great coffee.
Great coffee. Love the new location.
Amazing atmosphere.
Great service,  atmosphere and drink options!
Fantastic place, layout, and beverages.
Clean, chill and hip vibes. Love the space. The coffee is delicious and the food was amazing! Friendly baristas.
This branch is excellent for studying.
Good coffee
Fun atmosphere, yummy coffee and tea! Great place to bring your laptop and work! Beautiful patio too
You will not find a better latte in your lifetime. Every time I come to Charlotte my wife and I stop in.
lovely coffee & atmosphere
I love this place mostly because its the biggest building they own but also its not that busy yet. I could easily enjoy my latte while working on my laptop.
Great coffee and food and a great place to get work done.
Neat new location. Lots of space with high ceiling and comforts me seating. Great place to  meet up for business or with a friend. Coffee on point as always.
All good stuff . Very typical not just coffee but more spacious .
Spacious, lovely layout and amazing coffee. It seems like in the middle of no where but you'll be surprised what they've done with the place!

I've been to other NJC locations before and this is by far the most impressive location. The staff was friendly and I love the flexible seating layout -- there is something for everyone. I like this location because it's less hustle and bustle than most parts of town. Check it out.

Enjoyed visiting and would could back. Easily a place to relax and get some work done, small meeting, or relax before or after work with a delicious coffee. I ordered the mule which is a mix of ginger beer and espresso. Perfect to start my day. It has an open floor layout which means a lot of people can fit and enjoy the place with seating inside and out. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. Clean restrooms however no highchairs or changing tables if you're being small ones with you. Street parking is available in front with additional parking in the rear. Handicap parking is located along the side of the building.
